page.title: 04SOUTH WINGFIELD _ HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses in our area are concentrated in South Wingfield Village. Elsewhere the housing is mainly scattered farms and individual houses. There are some old cottages built of stone with stone roofs about two hundred and fifty years old although some of these have been modernised and now have new slate or tile roofs. A large number of the houses were built in late Victorian times and the early twentieth century. These are often of red brick with slate roofs some were also built as ribbon development in the inter_war period. About thirty years ago a small council development was built. Since then some old peoples sheltered housing has been constructed. Eight new houses are due for construction. Most houses are owner occupied and others rented from the council.
